channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Four Pakistani Men Sentenced to Death for ‘Honor Killing’
item.description: The father, a brother and two cousins of Farzana Parveen, who was bludgeoned to death on a busy street for marrying the man of her choice, were found guilty of the killing.
item.dc:creator: By WAQAR GILLANI

item.title: Jewish Victims, All From One Jerusalem Street, Were a Congregation’s ‘Wise Scholars’
item.description: Four Jewish men killed Tuesday while praying at their neighborhood synagogue all lived on the same block, and three were rabbis — one the scion of a celebrated Hasidic dynasty.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER, TIMOTHY WILLIAMS and JOSEPH BERGER
item.media:description: The funeral of Rabbi Moshe Twersky, below, one of four men killed Tuesday in their synagogue. A Druse traffic officer died outside.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Demanding Toilet Justice for the Women of China
item.description: On World Toilet Day, petitioners across China called on cities to install two women’s toilets for every men’s toilet.
item.dc:creator: By JESS MACY YU
item.media:description: A display at a trade show in Foshan, China. Petitioners in China are calling on cities to install two women's toilets for every men's toilet.

item.title: Fugitive Guru Arrested After Standoff With Indian Police
item.description: The spiritual leader had been barricaded in his compound with thousands of supporters in a weeklong standoff that had left six people dead.
item.dc:creator: By ELLEN BARRY and HARI KUMAR

item.title: Honduran Beauty Queen and Her Sister Are Found Dead
item.description: The Honduran police said María José Alvarado and her older sister, Sofía, had been shot and buried on a riverbank.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETH MALKIN

item.title: Police: Miss Honduras, Sister Apparently Killed
item.description: Two bodies believed to belong to Miss Honduras 2014 and her sister have been found buried near the spa where they disappeared six days ago, the Honduras National Police director said Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Special Report: Business of Green: Private Funding Brings a Boom in Hydropower, With High Costs
item.description: Developing countries are continuing to build large infrastructure projects despite concerns about their environmental impact and the fact they are displacing people.
item.dc:creator: By ERICA GIES
item.media:description: The Cahora Bassa Dam in Mozambique. A 2012 study found that ‘‘emissions from tropical hydropower are often underestimated and can exceed those of fossil fuel for decades.’’

item.title: Military Officer Named Interim Prime Minister in Burkina Faso
item.description: The appointment of Lt. Col. Isaac Zida was depicted as a trade-off for the military’s agreement to install a civilian president.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By HERVÉ TAOKO and ALAN COWELL

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Seeks to Become a ‘Polar-Region Power’
item.description: A day earlier, President Xi Jinping boarded a Chinese icebreaker in Tasmania and attended the signing of an agreement with Australia to strengthen their collaboration in Antarctica.
item.dc:creator: By BREE FENG
item.media:description: President Xi Jinping of China and Prime Minister Tony Abbott of Australia looking on as Liu Cigui, director of China's State Oceanic Administration, and Greg Hunt, Australia's environment minister, signed an agreement on Antarctic cooperation.

item.title: A Sudden Schism Between Shinzo Abe and the Bank of Japan Governor
item.description: Japan’s prime minister has postponed a planned tax increase championed by Haruhiko Kuroda, the bank’s governor, in a sharp break from their partnership.
item.dc:creator: By JONATHAN SOBLE
item.media:description: Haruhiko Kuroda, the Bank of Japan governor, has lobbied the prime minister to stick to a long-agreed timetable to increase the national sales tax.

item.title: Second Frenchman Is Identified in ISIS Video of Peter Kassig
item.description: French officials said they believe Michaël Dos Santos, 22, was among the militants who appeared unmasked in a video clip showing the beheaded American aid worker.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Frank-Walter Steinmeier Meets With Vladimir Putin
item.description: Mr. Steinmeier embodies the continued tension in Germany over how aggressively to assert itself on the world stage and how forcefully to confront Russia.
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: Frank-Walter Steinmeier, Germany's foreign minister, left, at a news conference with Sergey V. Lavrov, Russia's foreign minister, in Moscow on Tuesday.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributors: In Syria, Doctors Become the Victims
item.description: America must help protect medical personnel from Assad’s bombs.
item.dc:creator: By LEONARD S. RUBENSTEIN and M. ZAHER SAHLOUL

item.title: Israel Demolishes Family Home of Palestinian Driver Who Killed 2 Pedestrians
item.description: Security forces evacuated a five-story building and destroyed the apartment of the mother of Abdel Rahman al-Shaloudy, who killed a baby and a young woman last month.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: How Tunisia Will Succeed
item.description: Islamism or secularism is a false dichotomy. The real choice is between despotism and freedom.
item.dc:creator: By RACHID GHANNOUCHI

item.title: Fracas Puts Hong Kong Protests in New Light
item.description: A violent clash between demonstrators and the police underscored the difficulty the authorities face in evicting people from their barricaded tent cities.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and ALAN WONG

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: A Free Press for Vietnam
item.description: Alternative media cannot be the sole antidote to state control over mainstream news.
item.dc:creator: By NGUYEN CONG KHE

item.title: Wife of Mexican President to Sell Mansion
item.description: Mexico’s first lady, Angélica Rivera, a former soap opera star, has attracted intense criticism over the opulent home amid questions about how it was financed.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETH MALKIN

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China’s Industrial Heartland to Push Overflow Abroad
item.description: Hebei Province plans to shift some of its steel, cement and glass-making capacity elsewhere over the next decade, mostly likely to Africa and other countries in Asia.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: A crane carrying a roll of steel sheet at a factory in Hebei Province, which has said it plans to eliminate more than 60 million tons of steel capacity by 2017.

item.title: Organic Farms Become a Winner in Putin’s Feud With the West
item.description: With often cheaper imports unavailable, some agricultural activists hope to see a boost in local farming, but for consumers the self-imposed sanctions have so far served mostly to raise food prices.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Boris Akimov, who runs LavkaLavka, an organic farm cooperative, hopes that with the ban on Western imports, Russians will explore local foods.

item.title: Hong Kong Protesters Try to Break Into Legislative Building
item.description: Demonstrators thought to be from a more militant protest group smashed windows, and the main student groups leading the sit-ins around the complex distanced themselves from the actions.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and ALAN WONG
item.media:description: A broken window in the legislative building in the Admiralty district of Hong Kong on Wednesday after a group tried to break in.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Umbrellas Come Out at Hong Kong Graduation Ceremonies
item.description: The president of Hong Kong Baptist University, Albert Chan, refused to hand out diplomas to students who carried umbrellas onto the stage during graduation ceremonies.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE

item.title: Bangladesh Intercepts Ship Holding 600 Trafficking Victims
item.description: The passengers aboard the ship, mostly from Bangladesh or Myanmar, had been heading to Malaysia, the Bangladeshi Navy said.
item.dc:creator: By HARI KUMAR

item.title: Critic's Notebook: Berlin After the Wall: A Microcosm of the World’s Chaotic Change
item.description: Twenty-five years after the fall of the Berlin Wall, the city’s identity is still a work in progress.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL KIMMELMAN
item.media:description: An original segment of the Berlin Wall on display in Potsdamer Platz.

item.title: World Briefing: Honduras: 2 Arrested in Disappearance of Miss Honduras and Her Sister
item.description: The police said they arrested two suspects Tuesday in the disappearance last Thursday of Miss Honduras, María José Alvarado, 19, and her sister Sofía, 23.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETH MALKIN
